resources.string: A button that uses the full width of the screen looks like this:
A disabled button looks like this (any size):
This is an example app to demonstrate the design of a Privacy Friendly App. Further explanations can be found in the Privacy Friendly App Guide.

There are multiple ways to display basic buttons. Button 1 is the basic button. If you wish to separate a button visually, use button 2. The buttons 3–5 are examples for highlighted buttons. Depending on the app other colors are possible.
Use the button in the lower left corner to call the Welcome Dialog.
This is the default main menu for game apps. The viewpager above should be used to switch between game modes.

1. Inside the main menu, choose 'Workout'.
2. Choose a circuit exercise you would like to do.
3. Read the description of this circuit exercise and press 'Start' when ready.
4. Follow the workout instructions of the app. You can pause the workout anytime by pressing the 'Pause' button at the bottom of the screen.
is needed because … If XY is not granted feature YZ is not usable.
Privacy Friendly Example does not use any permissions.

This app guides you through a circuit training of your choice. An exercise \'circuit\' is one completion of multiple prescribed exercises. Different forms of exercise circuits target different workout goals such as strength, stamina, flexibility or agility.

This app provides a choice of different exercise circuits, each containing different combinations of exercises. The app then guides you through the circuit workout by showing which exercise to perform next and by displaying a timer. You can also add additional exercises and circuits to this app.
The category \'statistics\' shows the history of completed workout sessions and calories burned.
Udo Weber, Alexander Karakuz, Karola Marky
This application belongs to the group of Privacy Friendly Apps developed by Technische Universit√§t Darmstadt. Sourcecode licensed under GPLv3. Images copyright TU Darmstadt and Google Inc.
More information can be found on:

This App serves as a guideline to see the basic design of Privacy Friendly Apps. The sourcecode is available at GitHub. For further explanations have a look at the Privacy Friendly App Guide.\n\nThe welcome screen should introduce the app and the key elements of the start page.
